intro: Eriosema antunesii, commonly known as the Antunes' eriosema, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers, often with a distinctive scent. Its leaves are typically pinnate, and the stems are covered in a fine, woolly pubescence. Eriosema antunesii is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments.
